newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria Jan producer prices rise 42 pct mth/mth.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria Jan producer prices rise 42 pct mth/mth.

text.p: Bulgaria's monthly producer price inflation was 42.02 percent in January against 32 percent a month earlier, the National Statistics Institute (NSI) figures show.
BULGARIAN PRODUCER PRICES JAN DEC'96 JAN'96
"Prices of imported raw materials surged in January because of the sharp lev fall, boosting producer price inflation," an NSI official, who declined to be named, told Reuters.
Bulgaria is strongly dependent on imported raw materials, particularly oil-processing, energy production and metallurgy, the official said.
The lev fell to around 2,000 per dollar on the local interbank market at the end of January from around 600 a month earlier. It traded near 2,100 on Thursday.
According to an NSI survey, most local business managers expected producer prices to rise further amid the current economic crisis.
